revised_title: Miocene Plants of the Mackenzie River: Fossil Flora and Geological Context
tldr: This article discusses the Miocene plants discovered on the Mackenzie River, their geological context, and their connection to the Miocene flora of Europe and the Arctic regions. The author examines the plant specimens and compares them to other known Miocene deposits, concluding that the Mackenzie River deposits are part of the Miocene period. The article also mentions the importance of further study of these deposits for a better understanding of the region's geology and history.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Geology and Paleontology
